words.def: fertility goddess in ancient Greek mythology
swift timid long-eared mammal larger than a rabbit having a divided upper lip and long hind legs
A person especially a student with a posh accent who looks down on those who are 'common'.
a unit of surface area equal to 100 square meters
a period marked by distinctive character or reckoned from a fixed point or event
the sense organ for hearing and equilibrium
(astronomy) the angular distance of a celestial point measured westward along the celestial equator from the zenith crossing
a very light colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses
An instance of the interjection ah.
a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
a colorless and odorless inert gas
